channel.title: Dd-wrt
channel.description: When I got my Virgin Media 50meg Broadband they sent a free D-link DIR-615 router with it. Unfortunately, this is a pile of shit, so I looked into a solution to the frequent crashing and the connection dropping, and found that some people said that I should use DD-WRT. I was just wondering if it is worth it. Do you guys think that it would stop the crashing, or should I just get a new router?

item.title: Dd-wrt
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Ok guys, I’m now flashing my router with DD-WRT :).

Read full topic

item.title: Dd-wrt
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yes, it will definitely be better. I’ve used DD-WRT for many years on multiple routers and I’ve never had a problem with any of them, it’s nothing short of awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Dd-wrt
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

I bought a cheap Belkin last year for 50 bucks and it works like a train.
